title: Stock Futures, Bond Yields Stabilize After Fed-Driven Selloff
sub_head: The yield on the benchmark 10-year U.S. Treasury note edged down from the more than three-year high notched Wednesday
body:
U.S. stock futures edged higher and a selloff in U.S. government bonds stabilized as investors digested the possibility of more aggressive monetary tightening by the Federal Reserve.
Futures for the S&P 500 edged up 0.2% Thursday, a day after the benchmark gauge fell 1%. The selloff Wednesday followed the release of minutes from the Fed that showed central bankers considered raising rates by a half-percentage point at their March meeting, higher than the quarter-point increase with which they proceeded.
